Class Group25

java.lang.Object
Group25
public class Group25 extends Object
The Group 25's first OOP project

  • Field Details

    • sc

      public static final Scanner sc
      The single (static) Scanner object used for getting all inputs throughout the program. This prevents the System.in stream from being closed accidentally.

  • Constructor Details

    • Group25

      public Group25()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main entry point for the program. Displays the menus and handles navigation
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Clears the terminal screen. Uses 'cls' for Windows and 'clear' for Unix-based systems.

    • runPrimarySchool

      public static void runPrimarySchool()
      Runs the Primary School main menu. The user can choose from three options: 1) Age and Zodiac Sign Detection 2) Reverse the Words 3) Back to Main Menu

    • AgeAndZodiacDetection

      public static void AgeAndZodiacDetection()
      Gets user's birth date and today's date, then calculates the age and zodiac sign. Does not allow ages over 100 years.

    • askIntA

      public static int askIntA(String message, int min, int max)
      Asks the user to enter an integer and checks if it is valid.
      Parameters:
      message - The message shown to the user
      min - The minimum valid value
      max - The maximum valid value
      Returns:
      The integer entered by the user

    • isValidDate

      public static boolean isValidDate(int year, int month, int day)
      Checks if the given year, month, and day form a valid date.
      Parameters:
      year - Year
      month - Month
      day - Day
      Returns:
      True if the date is valid, false otherwise

    • calculateAge

      public static void calculateAge(int birthDay, int birthMonth, int birthYear, int currentDay, int currentMonth, int currentYear)
      Calculates the user's age and zodiac sign based on birth date and today's date. Displays the results in years, months, and days.
      Parameters:
      birthDay - The day of birth
      birthMonth - The month of birth
      birthYear - The year of birth
      currentDay - The current day
      currentMonth - The current month
      currentYear - The current year

    • calculateDaysInMonth

      public static int calculateDaysInMonth(int month, int year)
      Calculates how many days are in a given month and year. Accounts for leap years.
      Parameters:
      month - Month (1-12)
      year - Year
      Returns:
      Number of days in the month

    • calculateZodiacSign

      public static String calculateZodiacSign(int day, int month)
      Determines the zodiac sign based on day and month.
      Parameters:
      day - Day
      month - Month
      Returns:
      Zodiac sign as a string

    • ReverseTheWords

      public static void ReverseTheWords()
      Handles the "Reverse the Words" operation for the Primary School menu.

    • reverseWordsSymbols

      public static String reverseWordsSymbols(String text)
      Reverses words in a string. Words with 2 or more letters are reversed, single letters remain the same.
      Parameters:
      text - Input text
      Returns:
      Text with words reversed

    • reverseRecursive

      public static String reverseRecursive(String s)
      Recursively reverses a single word.
      Parameters:
      s - Word
      Returns:
      Reversed word

    • normalizeSpaces

      public static String normalizeSpaces(String Text)
      Normalizes spaces in a string. Trims leading and trailing spaces and replaces multiple spaces with a single space.
      Parameters:
      Text - Input text
      Returns:
      Normalized text

    • repeatOrReturn

      public static void repeatOrReturn(Runnable action, String menuName)
      Gives the user the option to repeat an operation or return to a specified menu. (Artık "menuName" parametresi alıyor)
      Parameters:
      action - The operation to repeat if the user chooses to repeat
      menuName - The name of the menu to return to (e.g., "Primary School")

    • secondaryMenu

      public static void secondaryMenu()
      Handles the menu for the Secondary School (Option B) operations.

    • eratosthenes

      public static void eratosthenes(int n)
      Operation 1.1: Finds all primes up to n using the Sieve of Eratosthenes.
      Parameters:
      n - The upper bound (inclusive) to find primes up to.

    • sundaram

      public static void sundaram(int n)
      Operation 1.2: Finds all primes up to n using the Sieve of Sundaram.
      Parameters:
      n - The upper bound (inclusive) to find primes up to.

    • atkin

      public static void atkin(int n)
      Operation 1.3: Finds all primes up to n using the Sieve of Atkin.
      Parameters:
      n - The upper bound (inclusive) to find primes up to.

    • operation2_evaluateExpression

      public static void operation2_evaluateExpression()
      Main function for Operation 2. Handles the user input loop, validation, and starts the recursive evaluation.

    • solveRecursively

      public static void solveRecursively(String currentExpr)
      This is the RECURSIVE helper function that replaces the while loop. It evaluates one step, prints it, and then calls itself with the new expression.
      Parameters:
      currentExpr - The expression to be evaluated in this step.

    • evaluateOneStep

      public static String evaluateOneStep(String expr)
      Finds and performs just one operation (the next one) based on precedence. Precedence Order: 1. Evaluate innermost parenthesis (...) 2. Unwrap simple parenthesis (number) -> number 3. Simplify adjacent operators -- -> +, +- -> -, -+ -> - 4. Multiplication / Division 5. Addition / Subtraction
      Parameters:
      expr - The current expression string.
      Returns:
      The expression string after performing one step.

    • reduceFully

      public static String reduceFully(String expr)
      Solves an expression (like one inside parentheses) all at once, without steps. Used to get a single result for a sub-expression.
      Parameters:
      expr - The expression to solve (e.g., "5*2-4").
      Returns:
      The final result as a string (e.g., "6").

    • performOperation

      public static String performOperation(String expr, int opIndex)
      Performs a single calculation (e.g., '5*2') at a specific index. Finds the left/right numbers, calculates the result, and rebuilds the string.
      Parameters:
      expr - The full expression string.
      opIndex - The index of the operator (e.g., '*').
      Returns:
      The new expression string with the operation completed.

    • findLeftNumber

      public static String findLeftNumber(String s, int startIndex)
      Helper function. Finds the full number (e.g., '-10' or '25') to the left of an operator by searching backwards.
      Parameters:
      s - The expression string.
      startIndex - The index to start searching from (op_index - 1).
      Returns:
      The found number as a string.

    • findRightNumber

      public static String findRightNumber(String s, int startIndex)
      Helper function. Finds the full number (e.g., '-3' or '+5') to the right of an operator by searching forwards.
      Parameters:
      s - The expression string.
      startIndex - The index to start searching from (op_index + 1).
      Returns:
      A string "number;length" (e.g., "-3;2") indicating the number and how many characters it consumed.

    • calculate

      public static String calculate(String num1, char op, String num2)
      Performs the actual math on two numbers (as strings). Handles basic arithmetic and throws an error for division by zero.
      Parameters:
      num1 - Left number (e.g., "5").
      op - Operator (e.g., '*').
      num2 - Right number (e.g., "-3").
      Returns:
      The result as a string (e.g., "-15").

    • isValidExpression

      public static boolean isValidExpression(String s)
      Checks if the user's raw input is valid based on project rules. This is the main safeguard against invalid expressions.
      Parameters:
      s - The raw expression string from the user.
      Returns:
      true if the expression is valid, false otherwise.

    • tidy

      public static String tidy(String s)
      A simple cleanup utility. Simplifies '+-' to '-' and '-+' to '-' after an operation rebuilds the string.
      Parameters:
      s - The string to clean.
      Returns:
      The cleaned string.

    • isNumeric

      public static boolean isNumeric(String s)
      Checks if a string is a single number (positive or negative). Used to know when the evaluation is finished.
      Parameters:
      s - The string to check.
      Returns:
      true if the string is only a number, false otherwise.

    • prettyPrint

      public static String prettyPrint(String s)
      Converts the internal format ('*', '/') back to the user-facing format ('x', ':') for printing.
      Parameters:
      s - The internal expression string.
      Returns:
      The "pretty" string for the user to see.

    • HighSchoolMenu

      public static void HighSchoolMenu()
      High School Menu Displays a menu with options to calculate statistical information about an array or distance between two arrays.

    • staticinfoArray

      public static void staticinfoArray()
      Statistical Information about an Array Prompts the user for the array size and double elements. Computes and prints: median, arithmetic mean, geometric mean, and harmonic mean. The harmonic mean is computed using a recursive reciprocal-sum helper. For even-sized arrays, the median is the average of the two middle elements after sorting.

    • calculateMedian

      public static double calculateMedian(double[] array)
      Calculate Median Calculates the median of an array.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to calculate the median of
      Returns:
      the median of the array

    • calculateArithmeticMean

      public static double calculateArithmeticMean(double[] array)
      Calculate Arithmetic Mean Calculates the arithmetic mean of an array.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to calculate the arithmetic mean of
      Returns:
      the arithmetic mean of the array

    • calculateGeometricMean

      Parameters:
      array - the array to calculate the geometric mean of
      Returns:
      the geometric mean of the array

      Returns:

    • calculateReciprocalSumRecursive

      public static double calculateReciprocalSumRecursive(double[] array, int index)
      Calculate Reciprocal Sum Recursively Calculates the reciprocal sum of an array recursively.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to calculate the reciprocal sum of
      index - the index to calculate the reciprocal sum of
      Returns:
      the reciprocal sum of the array

    • distanceBetweenArrays

      public static void distanceBetweenArrays()
      Distance between Two Arrays Computes the Cosine similarity between vectors a and b: (a · b) / (||a|| * ||b||), where ||v|| = sqrt(Σ v_i^2). Returns 0 if either vector has zero magnitude.

    • validInteger

      public static int validInteger(String message)
      Validate Integer Validates an integer input.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to display
      Returns:
      the validated integer

    • manhattanDistance

      public static double manhattanDistance(int[] a, int[] b)
      Calculate Manhattan Distance Calculates the Manhattan distance between two arrays.
      Parameters:
      a - the first array
      b - the second array
      Returns:
      the Manhattan distance between the two arrays

    • euclideanDistance

      public static double euclideanDistance(int[] a, int[] b)
      Calculate Euclidean Distance Calculates the Euclidean distance between two arrays.
      Parameters:
      a - the first array
      b - the second array
      Returns:
      the Euclidean distance between the two arrays

    • cosineSimilarity

      public static double cosineSimilarity(int[] a, int[] b)
      Calculate Cosine Similarity Calculates the cosine similarity between two arrays.
      Parameters:
      a - the first array
      b - the second array
      Returns:
      the cosine similarity between the two arrays

    • connectFourMenu

      public static void connectFourMenu()
      Handles the connectfour menu when user enter option D in the main menu.

    • connectFourFlow

      public static void connectFourFlow()
      Handles how the game goes after the menu screen.

    • initializeBoard

      public static char[][] initializeBoard(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a new game board of the given dimensions and fills it with the ' ' (space) character.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows for the board.
      cols - The number of columns for the board.
      Returns:
      A new 2D char array (board) filled with spaces.

    • displayBoard

      public static void displayBoard(char[][] board)
      Renders the current state of the game board to the console, including column numbers.
      Parameters:
      board - The 2D char array (board) to display.

    • isColumnFull

      public static boolean isColumnFull(char[][] board, int column)
      Checks if a specific column on the board is full (by checking the top row).
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      column - The column index to check.
      Returns:
      true if the column is full, false otherwise.

    • dropDisc

      public static void dropDisc(char[][] board, int column, char disc)
      Drops a player's disc ('X' or 'O') into the selected column. The disc settles in the lowest available row of that column.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      column - The column index to drop the disc into.
      disc - The player's disc ('X' or 'O').

    • checkWinner

      public static boolean checkWinner(char[][] b, char d)
      Checks if the specified player (represented by their disc) has won the game. Scans for horizontal, vertical, and diagonal fours.
      Parameters:
      b - The board (2D char array).
      d - The player's disc ('X' or 'O') to check for.
      Returns:
      true if the player has won, false otherwise.

    • isDraw

      public static boolean isDraw(char[][] b)
      Checks if the game is a draw (i.e., if the board is completely full).
      Parameters:
      b - The game board.
      Returns:
      true if the board is full (draw), false otherwise.

    • computerMove

      public static int computerMove(char[][] board, char me, char opp, Random rng)
      Determines the computer's (AI) next move.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      me - The computer's disc ('O').
      opp - The opponent's (human) disc ('X').
      rng - A Random object for making random moves.
      Returns:
      The column index the computer has chosen.

    • leadsToWin

      public static boolean leadsToWin(char[][] board, int c, char disc)
      Simulates whether a specific move (dropping a disc in a column) leads to a win.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      c - The column index to test.
      disc - The player's disc to test.
      Returns:
      true if this move results in a win, false otherwise.

    • findDropRow

      public static int findDropRow(char[][] board, int c)
      Finds the row where a disc would land if dropped in a specific column.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board.
      c - The column index to check.
      Returns:
      The row index where the disc would land. Returns -1 if the column is full.

    • waitMs

      public static void waitMs(long ms)
      Pauses program execution for a specified number of milliseconds using a 'busy-wait' loop.
      Parameters:
      ms - The duration to wait (in milliseconds).

    • pause

      public static void pause()
      Pauses the program until the user presses the Enter key.

    • sleep

      public static void sleep(long ms)
      Puts the current thread to sleep for the specified duration (using Thread.sleep).
      Parameters:
      ms - The sleep duration (in milliseconds).

    • displayWelcomeMessage

      public static void displayWelcomeMessage()
      Displays our ASCII message
